intro: Manihot tombadorensis, commonly known as the Tombador arrowleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Manihot. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
